messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I live in Lepente, and I think someone's trying to come in.
Okay, I just heard the window break. Hold on. What's your address?
Huh? Cross street.
What's your cross street?
I'm not sure.
Okay, do you think someone's trying to come in right now?
Yeah.
What are you hearing?
Well, they kept on ringing the doorbell.
What's your phone number?
Give me one second. Let me look up your address.
Okay, where are you at right now?
I'm in my parents' bedroom.
Okay, stay on the line, don't hang up.
Okay.
You said someone was ringing the doorbell?

They kept on ringing the doorbell, and I've been looking out the window for cars, but there's no cars outside. And then I heard them banging on the window, and then all of a sudden I heard glass shatter.
So you heard someone banging on the window and glass shattering?
Yeah.
Stay on the line, okay?
All right.
What are you hearing now?
I think someone's in the house.
Where do you think they're at?
Towards the other side of the house, like where my bedroom and my sister's bedroom are at.
How many people do you hear?
I think it's just one, but I don't hear them talking.
What else can you hear?
I don't know. I can't hear anything anymore.
Okay, where are you in the bedroom?
I'm over here towards the front of the house next to the window.
Is there a closet you can go into?
There is, but there's too much stuff in it. They'll probably hear me.
Okay, where are you in your mom's room?
In the corner. If you go through the house, you see that there's a window, and I'm right there.
Are you calling me from a cell phone or a landline?
I'm calling from a phone from the house.
Okay, can you hear anything else?
Not much.
Can you hear if doors are opening?
I'm not sure.
Which window broke? Where did you hear the shattering from?
My sister's window. It's on the other side of the house.
Okay, if the deputies were coming to the front, how would they see the broken window so they know where the person possibly came in?
From the front door, if you're facing it, to your left all the way up on the far side, you'll see this window.
Okay, you haven't heard any more doors open or shut?
No.
Okay, what are you wearing?
I'm wearing blue jeans and a white t-shirt.
A white t-shirt and what color pants?
Blue. Skinny jeans.
Okay. How can the deputies get into the house?
My parents always said not to let anybody in, but I'll try to unlock the door.
Okay, are you hearing anything new?
No.
How old are you?
I'm only 15.
Okay, he's not hearing anything right now.
The deputies are on their way, okay?
All right.
How many times did they ring the doorbell?
A few times over, let's say, three minutes, like over and over.
And when you went to the door, what happened?
I didn't, my mom said not to open the door for anybody.
Did you look out?
Yeah, I tried to, but there's no peephole or window to look through.
Okay, are you hearing anything new?
I could have sworn I heard someone walking around, but that could have just been my mind.
Okay, they're in the house?
Yeah.
How are you certain they're in the house?
I hear footsteps in the kitchen.
He's hearing footsteps in the kitchen.
I don't know if I can open the door without them finding me.
Okay, just stay quiet, okay?
Please come.
Is there a bed you could go under?
I'm trying to.
Take the phone with you, okay?
All right.
Are you under the bed?
I'm trying, but I'm too big.
Can you grab a blanket and throw it over you?
All right.
Keep the phone with you.
I can't fit under the bed, I'm too big.
Do you have some blankets or something to disguise yourself?
I'm trying to run out.
Okay, what else do you hear?
Nothing much.
Thank you. Are the deputies there yet?
We have one unit out in the front.
If you hear them come in the bedroom, let me know. Stay where you are and stay on the line, okay?
Okay, there's a deputy in the front.
They're waiting for another unit to get there to enter the house.
All right.
Are you hearing anything new?
Not sure. They could be looking for something or walking out.
Okay. Just know that the deputies are there, okay?
All right.
He's not hearing anything right now.
